text: We have integrated slack and HubSpot. Until recently we were able to add tickets and task to HubSpot from Slack. Now it is not working anymore. Task we create in HubSpot is still coming into Slack, but not the other way around. When I choose to assign a task from Slack to HubSpot, I am no longer able to choose any of my team member in the pop-up window from HubSpot. I can only assign task or ticket to my self.
Does anyone have an idea where to start investigate?
Help me understand a bit more <@UF9G0E1L6> - is this native functionality built into HubSpot Service Hub -or- is this something custom your team developed?

Hello <@U22PKFRU5> It is a native functionality. We didn’t build anything. I have choicen to add HubSpot as an app from slack. And it worked perfect, until last week, when I tried to add a new shared email in HubSpot Communication. I am not sure if this was the reason why it was broken, but after that I can’t associate any ticket or task with any of my team. Who is also part of  HubSpot
thanks <@U7SL518D6> - that is what I did - I used MMJL worked well
is there a HubL function that suggests blog posts to the reader - based on the blog they are reading???
I'm debugging IE10 for a client, and it throws syntax errors on `const` and `let` :slightly_smiling_face:
And as far as I can see, that's the only block from HubSpot containing `const`
Is it included by default, or can I edit that code block somewhere?
you could add the modified version inside an if IE10 conditional
Yeah, but I can't find the code anywhere. It's rendered _below_ the Site footer HTML (the one in Settings)

got it - for this specific challenge - I would suggest (if you haven't already)

1. Call/chat with customer support 
2. Also copy/paste posting this question in <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/Tickets-Conversations/bd-p/service_conversations_tickets>
This slack isn't an official support channel for HubSpot (more of a community relationship and collab thing, although questions do get asked/anwered so it's always worth a shot) . Most of the conversation in here is around coding custom stuff using the CMS and APIs. Not sure how familiar folks are with Service tools in here.

Because this is natively built functionality the customer support team should be able to help.
If for some reason they can't, the support forum has even more HubSpotters and community members who are specifically using Service Hub tools.

Yeah that code is automatically added by HubSpot.
I’m not entirely sure you can change it… maybe if you used a coded template and did a replace on the standard footer includes but that seems very hacky
